title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: " Of something far more deeply interfused, Whose dwelling is the light of setting suns, Aud the round ocean and the living air, And the blue sky, aud in the mind of man ; A motion and a spirit that impels All thinking things, all objects of all thought, And rolb through all things."

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Wae is ray heart, and the tear's in my ee ; lang, lang-, joy's been a stranger to me : Forsaken and friendless, my burden I bear, Aud the sweet voice o' pity ne'er sounds in my ear.

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: The graces of her weel-faur'd face, Aud the glaucin' of her sparklm' een !

title: Waverley Novels. (Abbotsford edition.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Four ruffians seized me yester morn —Alas ! a maiden most forlorn !They choked my cries with wicked might,Aud bound me on a palfiey white.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Where next stood, to bide the crush,The volunteers, who zealous,Kept firing close, till near surrounded,Aud by the flying horse confounded:Thev suffer'd sair into this place,No Highlander pitied their case :' You cursed militia,' they did swear,' What a devil did bring you here ?' "History ofthe Rebellion in 1745-174G.—S,

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: For all our men were very very merry,Aud all our men were drinking:
